df-rngohom
blocks.content: Define the function which gives the set of ring homomorphisms between two given rings. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-rngohom(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(crnghom, cmpo(s0, s1, crngo, crngo, crab(s2, co(crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s1))), cmap, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0)))), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)))), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)))), wral(s3, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), wral(s4, crn(cfv(c1st, cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cfv(c1st, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(c1st, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)))), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), cfv(c2nd, cv(s0)), cv(s4))), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(c2nd, cv(s1)), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-rngohom(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ⊢ RngHom =(s0 ∈ RingOps, s1 ∈ RingOps ↦ { s2 ∈(ran((1st ` s1))[↦]ran((1st ` s0)))|((s2 `(GId `(2nd ` s0)))=(GId `(2nd ` s1))∧ ∀(s3 ∈ ran((1st ` s0)), ∀(s4 ∈ ran((1st ` s0)),((s2 `(s3[(1st ` s0)]s4))=((s2 ` s3)[(1st ` s1)](s2 ` s4))∧(s2 `(s3[(2nd ` s0)]s4))=((s2 ` s3)[(2nd ` s1)](s2 ` s4))))))})
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: rngohomf
blocks.content: A ring homomorphism is a function. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)
blocks.origin:
thm rngohomf(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, co(c0, crnghom, c1))), wf(c2, c3, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c1st, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, crn(c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c1st, c1))
  -| wceq(c4, crn(c6))
} = {
  3impa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, co(c0, crnghom, c1)), wf(c2, c3, c4))
  simp1d(wa(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo)), wcel(c2, co(c0, crnghom, c1))), wf(c2, c3, c4), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c0))), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c1))), wral(hs0, c3, wral(hs1, c3, wa(wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), c5, cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), c6, cfv(c2, cv(hs1)))), wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cfv(c2nd, c0), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2nd, c1), cfv(c2, cv(hs1))))))))
  biimpa(wa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo)), wcel(c2, co(c0, crnghom, c1)), w3a(wf(c2, c3, c4), wceq(cfv(c2, cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c0))), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c1))), wral(hs0, c3, wral(hs1, c3, wa(wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), c5, cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), c6, cfv(c2, cv(hs1)))), wceq(cfv(c2, co(cv(hs0), cfv(c2nd, c0), cv(hs1))), co(cfv(c2, cv(hs0)), cfv(c2nd, c1), cfv(c2, cv(hs1)))))))))
  isrngohom(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c0)), cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c1)), c5, c6, cfv(c2nd, c0), cfv(c2nd, c1))
  eqid(cfv(c2nd, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c0)))
  eqid(cfv(c2nd, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cgi, cfv(c2nd, c1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
}

thm rngohomf(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ RingOps ∧ c2 ∈(c0[RngHom]c1))→(c2 : c3 → c4))
  ⊣ c5 =(1st ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 = ran(c5)
  ⊣ c6 =(1st ` c1)
  ⊣ c4 = ran(c6)
} = {
  3impa(c0 ∈ RingOps, c1 ∈ RingOps, c2 ∈(c0[RngHom]c1), (c2 : c3 → c4))
  simp1d(((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ RingOps)∧ c2 ∈(c0[RngHom]c1)), (c2 : c3 → c4), (c2 `(GId `(2nd ` c0)))=(GId `(2nd ` c1)), ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, ∀(hs1 ∈ c3,((c2 `(hs0[c5]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[c6](c2 ` hs1))∧(c2 `(hs0[(2nd ` c0)]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[(2nd ` c1)](c2 ` hs1))))))
  biimpa((c0 ∈ RingOps ∧ c1 ∈ RingOps), c2 ∈(c0[RngHom]c1), ((c2 : c3 → c4)∧(c2 `(GId `(2nd ` c0)))=(GId `(2nd ` c1))∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ c3, ∀(hs1 ∈ c3,((c2 `(hs0[c5]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[c6](c2 ` hs1))∧(c2 `(hs0[(2nd ` c0)]hs1))=((c2 ` hs0)[(2nd ` c1)](c2 ` hs1)))))))
  isrngohom(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, (GId `(2nd ` c0)), (GId `(2nd ` c1)), c5, c6, (2nd ` c0), (2nd ` c1))
  eqid((2nd ` c0))
  eqid((GId `(2nd ` c0)))
  eqid((2nd ` c1))
  eqid((GId `(2nd ` c1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
}

blocks.content: A ring homomorphism preserves ` 1 ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 24-Jun-2011.)

thm rngohom1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, co(c0, crnghom, c1))), wceq(cfv(c2, c3), c4))

blocks.name: rngoisoco
blocks.content: The composition of two ring isomorphisms is a ring isomorphism. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 16-Jun-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm rngoisoco(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, crngo)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crngiso, c2)))), wcel(ccom(c4, c3), co(c0, crngiso, c2)))
} = {
  mpbir2and(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, crngo)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crngiso, c2)))), wcel(ccom(c4, c3), co(c0, crngiso, c2)), wcel(ccom(c4, c3), co(c0, crnghom, c2)), wf1o(ccom(c4, c3), crn(cfv(c1st, c0)), crn(cfv(c1st, c2))))
  syldan(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, crngo)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crngiso, c2))), wcel(ccom(c4, c3), co(c0, crnghom, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, co(c0, crnghom, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crnghom, c2))))
  anim12da(w3a(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, crngo)), wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crngiso, c2)), wcel(c3, co(c0, crnghom, c1)), wcel(c4, co(c1, crnghom, c2)))
  3adantl3(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c2, crngo), wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c3, co(c0, crnghom, c1)))
  3expa(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, crngo), wcel(c3, co(c0, crngiso, c1)), wcel(c3, co(c0, crnghom, c1)))
